content: u should really remove the binary output since i could do print("true") and get 66%
N should be given on the first line of the input (and the stub improved accordingly to parse the list).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like this puzzle. It is simple. 
The difficulty resides in finding the solution to the mathematical problem. Once found the answer is quite trivial. 
I think it can be done under 5 minutes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment:
good

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Hard to find the mathematical concept in 15min

Good one but I spend more than 15min to found the mathematical solution... 

I will approve it only if it's mentioned in the goal how to solve the problem :
                         The greater distance should be less than the sum of all the other distance.

Really like this one :) Just a few notes

MAJOR: N <=10^13 make it 20 or 30 :) - you have no testcase for such a huge input (also less optimal solutions can exceed time quota)

MINOR: `read MESSAGE:string(1000)` - will generate code with variable named MESSAGE of type string. I'd rename it to `distances` (you are using exactly the same word in you CoC description). Personally I'd also use loop for reading the distances, but that is really personal preference

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice idea, original, I like it.

Maybe modify :

Output 

true if  the input can be the sides lenght of a polygon
or false otherwise
Euh... Si je comprends bien faut juste voir si une des valeurs n'est pas plus grande que la somme de toutes les autres, c'est ça ?
This is great, but wouldn't the "without instruction" challenge be a bit too hard ?
M first comment - nice maths puzzle.
Love it! Great idea :)

Hi everyone,
It is my first contribution.

Any feedbacks will be appreciated. :)
Thank you

Yes it could be,
i want to do just triangle at first. and maybe it will be more easier with only 3 distances.

I could remove "without instruction" if  it makes sense for some other readers.

tell me guys.
C'est ca :)

ok, i change it by :
true if you can build a polygon with those distances (even flat)
or false otherwise
Thank you very much

ok, i change it.
Thank you for your feedback.

Hi Lours,

It is the goal of the puzzle, i won't  give the solution in the goal. don't you think ?

For information,
My 12 years old daughter, just learn this property for a triangle at school.
So big thanks to her, that inspire this puzzle.
Thank you for the approval :)
Thank you for the approval :)

Hi BenjilsBack,

Get the hint : I am older than 12 years old and I don't remember old my math classes. 

In my opinion and maybe I am wrong the goal of the clash is to test the ability to code not to remember all the old school knowledge...

I code physics, math, electrical, vision, IA theories for those who don't know code and I am far away an expert in those domain.

At least if you had the goal (remember the solution is the code not the mathematical concept), I will learn/remember something about math and it's cool !

To conclude on an example, I did a CoC where the goal was to find out if a point is inside or outside a triangle, given only the coordinates  for each sides of the triangle (x,y) and for the points. I wasn't able to manage the mathematical concept in 15min, I asked a friend who is teaching mathematics in university, He figured it out in more than 15min and I code it may be in 10 to 15 min... So given the mathematical concept is part of the goal not of the solution !!

I understand what you mean.

But for many coc i have done, most of the times we have to figured out what have to be done. And goal doesn't explain how to do it.

For me CodingGame is also find the algorythm. And not just code.

Sorry.
Not my vision but I understand
Just a last comment, anyone can just do quick search on the internet to find this property, like for a point is inside or outside a triangle. (but this one is clearly not for a CoC)

Idk what to say, if you think you are right, do as you think. Whatever you are going to do, some people will agree and others don't...

In my vision and maybe I am wrong.

Here are the main step, we are realising when doing a CoC in 15min :

            1°) Read the problem
            2°) Understand the problem's concept
            3°) Translate the concept into code
            4°) Tests
            5°) Correction
            6°) Validation

First step : If the CoC is in French and I don't speak french. Does it make me a bad developer ? For my point of view,  this should not be the blocking point. 

Second step : If I am an expert in Chemistry but the CoC is in an electrical problem. How long (with internet reasearches, etc..) does it will take to me to understand ? And if I don't, does it make me a bad developer compare to someone who knows and/or understand the concept ? 

From step 3 to 6 : The reason why we are all here. Improving our developing skills and testing them on various understanble problems.

 In the game, you propose a length code. Imagine we had the CoC together.

2 cases:

1°) I will probably failed due to lack of knowledge. And I will be disappointed by the easy solution...
 
2°) I understand the concept, I can challenge you with a smaller code. If I win or not, anyway, we will have access to our code and maybe learn something.

Knowledges is golden, some people keeps it for themshelf, others are sharing. Both are living in the same world !
